remarks.para: The is a scrollable control similar to the control. You can configure ranges through which the value of the property of a track bar scrolls by setting the property to specify the lower end of the range and the property to specify the upper end of the range.
The property defines the increment to add or subtract from the property when clicks occur on either side of the scroll box. The track bar can be displayed horizontally or vertically.
You can use this control to input numeric data obtained through the property. You can display this numeric data in a control or use it in code.

summary.para: Represents a standard Windows track bar.

remarks.para: The is created with a default horizontal orientation and a range of 0 to 10, with a tick mark shown for every value.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool AutoSize { set; get; }

remarks.para: You can set the property to true to cause the track bar to adjust its height (if horizontally aligned) or width (if vertically aligned). The height or width is adjusted to a standard size based on the screen resolution on which the track bar is displayed. Set the property to false if you want to adjust the size yourself.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the height or width of the track bar is being automatically sized.

remarks.para: For more information about handling events, see Consuming Events.

summary.para: Occurs when the value of the property changes.

summary.para: Gets the foreground color of the track bar.
Occurs when the property changes.
Gets or sets the Input Method Editor (IME) mode supported by this control.
Occurs when the property changes.
Handles special input keys, such as PAGE UP, PAGE DOWN, HOME, and END.

remarks.para: When the user presses the PAGE UP or PAGE DOWN key or clicks the track bar on either side of the scroll box, the property changes according to the value set in the property. You might consider setting the value to a percentage of the (for a vertically oriented track bar) or (for a horizontally oriented track bar) value. This keeps the distance your track bar moves proportionate to its size.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value to be added to or subtracted from the property when the scroll box is moved a large distance.

remarks.para: You can use the method to set both the and properties at the same time.

summary.para: Gets or sets the upper limit of the range this is working with.

summary.para: Gets or sets the lower limit of the range this is working with.

This method is called by the control when any property changes. Inheriting controls can override this method to get property change notification on basic properties. Inheriting controls must call base.propertyChanged.
Use the method.

Docs.param: An that contains the event data.

remarks.para: Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Raising an Event.
The method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

remarks.para: When the property is set to , the scroll box moves from left to right as the increases. When the property is set to , the scroll box moves from bottom to top as the increases.

Docs.param: The lower limit of the range of the track bar.
The upper limit of the range of the track bar.

remarks.para: When the user presses one of the arrow keys, the property changes according to the value set in the property.

You might consider setting the value of to a percentage of the value of the (for a vertically oriented track bar) or (for a horizontally oriented track bar) property. This sets the distance your track bar moves proportionate to its size.

summary.para: Gets or sets the value added to or subtracted from the property when the scroll box is moved a small distance.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string Text { set; get; }

remarks.para: This property is not relevant for this class.

summary.para: Gets or sets the text of the .
Occurs when the property changes.

remarks.para: For a with a large range of values between the and the properties, it might be impractical to draw all the ticks for values on the control. For example, if you have a control with a range of 100, passing in a value of 5 here causes the control to draw 20 ticks. In this case, each tick represents five units in the range of values.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value that specifies the delta between ticks drawn on the control.

remarks.para: You can use the property to modify the manner in which the tick marks are displayed on the track bar.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating how to display the tick marks on the track bar.

remarks.para: The method returns a string that includes the type and the values for the , , and properties.

summary.para: Returns a string that represents the control.

returns.para: A string that represents the current .

remarks.para: The property contains the number that represents the current position of the scroll box on the track bar.

summary.para: Gets or sets a numeric value that represents the current position of the scroll box on the track bar.

remarks.para: You can use this event to update other controls when the value represented in the track bar changes.
For more information about handling events, see Consuming Events.

summary.para: Occurs when the property of a track bar changes, either by movement of the scroll box or by manipulation in code.
